name: INF1220 M1 Codex Tutor (AlgoCtrl + 3P + ACS)
description: Codex skill for INF1220 Module 1 (M1-07 algorithms + math recall): generate INF1220-style pseudocode solutions with interpreter-style traces, minimal tests, and objective coverage reporting using 3 Pillars + AlgoCtrl + Adaptive Control Strategies.

primary: INF1220 course materials (pseudocode conventions are authoritative)
support_oracle: Python is allowed only as a verification oracle and must be labeled NON-SUBMISSION unless explicitly requested

inputs.name: user_input
inputs.description: Problem statement OR objective keys OR draft code/pseudocode to debug.

inputs.name: mode
inputs.description: stdout: print markdown only; artifacts: also write out/ files when requested.

artifacts.description: Optional runnable verification script mirroring the pseudocode (clearly NON-SUBMISSION).

evidence.description: Optional machine-readable evidence: objective_keys_used, tests_run (if any), assumptions, failure_modes.

quality_gates: No unexplained leaps: every result must be traceable via steps.
Boolean logic: precedence explicit via parentheses or justified by a truth table.
Loops: explicit termination condition and a variant (what progresses each iteration).
Arrays: explicit indexing base (0 vs 1) and bounds.
Accumulators: explicitly define behavior on empty input.
Ambiguity: ask at most one clarifying question, then proceed with stated assumptions.

helpers.name: extract_objectives
helpers.description: Reads assets/inf1220_m1.json and prints an Objective Index (keys + titles).
